title: Core Architecture Performance Comparison
setup: Compare K-Planes, GA-Planes, NeRF, and Gaussian-splats on standardized 2D matrix reconstruction tasks. Use identical training protocols (Adam optimizer, 1000 epochs) across 10+ diverse image datasets. Measure PSNR, parameter count, training time, and memory usage.
results: Expected: K-Planes achieves >5dB PSNR improvement over NeRF baseline, >2x parameter efficiency, >50% faster convergence across >80% test datasets
notes: Primary hypothesis test for architecture superiority. Critical for validating core research direction. Requires careful implementation bias mitigation.
dataFiles: CIFAR-10, ImageNet samples, DIV2K, synthetic patterns, medical images, technical imagery

title: Scaling Behavior Analysis
setup: Multi-resolution evaluation across resolutions [64, 128, 192, 256, 320, 384, 448, 512] for each architecture. Control for feature dimensions and training protocol. Measure PSNR per parameter and computational complexity (FLOPs).
results: Expected: K-Planes shows sublinear parameter growth with resolution compared to NeRF's linear growth, maintains reconstruction quality with fewer parameters
notes: Tests architectural scalability hypothesis. Can run in parallel with exp-1.1. Critical for understanding practical deployment constraints.

title: Decoder Architecture Ablation
setup: Systematic comparison of decoder types with fixed K-Planes backbone: Linear (nn.Linear), Nonconvex (Linear’ReLU’Linear), Convex (fc1*ReLU(fc2)). Control for feature dimensions and capacity. Profile computational cost.
results: Expected: Linear decoder + K-Planes achieves within 1dB of nonconvex MLP while requiring <50% computational cost
notes: Tests hypothesis 2 about decoder complexity necessity. Key for efficiency optimization. Requires careful capacity matching across decoder types.
dataFiles: Subset of primary datasets for controlled comparison

title: Positional Encoding Comparison
setup: Compare encoding strategies: K-Planes native, Fourier features (multiple frequency ranges), SIREN activation, no encoding baseline. Full factorial design across architectures. Measure convergence rate and final performance.
results: Expected: Native K-Planes encoding outperforms Fourier features by >2dB PSNR, 2D-optimized encodings converge faster than 3D adaptations
notes: Tests hypothesis 3 about encoding transferability. Can run in parallel with exp-2.1. Important for understanding domain-specific optimization.
dataFiles: Standard datasets with spatial frequency analysis

title: Interpolation Method Analysis
setup: Compare interpolation methods with K-Planes architecture: bilinear (F.grid_sample bilinear), nearest neighbor, learned interpolation weights. Analyze across image types (smooth, textured, high-frequency). Profile computational cost.
results: Expected: Bilinear interpolation achieves within 0.5dB of learned interpolation, computational savings justify quality trade-offs
notes: Tests hypothesis 5 about interpolation complexity. Lower priority than core architecture comparison. Focus on computational efficiency analysis.

title: Quantization-Aware Training Analysis
setup: Implement QAT using existing QuantizedModel framework. Test 4-bit, 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit precision across architectures. Measure PSNR retention, model size reduction, quantization sensitivity. Focus on K-Planes vs NeRF robustness.
results: Expected: 4-bit QAT maintains within 1dB PSNR, achieves >4x model size reduction, K-Planes shows better quantization robustness than NeRF
notes: Tests hypothesis 4 about parameter efficiency. Critical for deployment applications. Uses existing quantization infrastructure.

title: Sparsity and Compression Analysis
setup: Progressive sparsity analysis using topk_filter implementation. Test sparsity levels [50%, 70%, 90%, 95%] across architectures. Combine with quantization for maximum compression. Generate Pareto frontier for compression vs quality.
results: Expected: 90% sparsity maintains >90% original PSNR, combination achieves >10x compression, sparse K-Planes outperform sparse traditional methods
notes: Extends quantization work. Can run in parallel with exp-3.1. Important for resource-constrained deployment. Uses existing sparse_project function.

title: CPU-Friendly Implementation Optimization
setup: Develop CPU-optimized implementations for 2D architectures. Benchmark performance across hardware platforms (CPU vs GPU). Profile memory usage and optimization opportunities. Validate accuracy retention.
results: Expected: 2D K-Planes achieves >3x speedup on CPU vs 3D-adapted versions, memory scales favorably, maintains competitive accuracy
notes: Practical deployment focus. Lower research priority but high practical impact. Requires hardware-specific optimization expertise.

title: Cross-Experiment Validation and Statistical Analysis
setup: Comprehensive statistical analysis across all experiments. Paired t-tests with Bonferroni correction, effect size analysis (Cohen's d), 95% confidence intervals. Validate primary hypotheses with p<0.01 threshold. Cross-validate results across datasets.
results: Expected: Statistical validation of primary hypotheses, identification of effect sizes, comprehensive evidence for literature-level impact
notes: Critical final step. Determines research success. Requires rigorous statistical methodology. Should inform final paper conclusions.
codeRepo: Statistical analysis scripts and validation framework
